p: When estimating the time between the infectious blood meal and the detection of virus in mosquito saliva (namely the extrinsic incubation period, EIP), Ae. albopictus Tunisia mosquitoes were more efficient to transmit CHIKV, ZIKV and DENV, in descending order, with EIP of 3, 10 and 21 days respectively. Viral loads in abdomen and head/thorax were significantly higher for mosquitoes infected with CHIKV than with DENV and ZIKV (Mann-Whitney tests (2 by 2): P < 0.05, S2A and S2B Fig).
